page.title: 15Severn Navigation Scheme
page.content: A current issue is whether the Severn Navigation Restoration Trust should be allowed to restore navigable depth to the Severn between Bewdley and Bridgnorth. A weir and boom at Dowles would form part of the scheme. Anglers, conservationists and residents oppose the idea. The ecology would be upset, ponding effects could cause pollution and the canoeists would lose the rapids at Trimpley. On the other hand large visiting boats moored in the proposed marinas would bring prosperity to the area. Councillors are awaiting a full report before deciding whether to help with funds.Aesthetic and biological aspects have to be considered. Deepening the river would mean a total restructuring of a main water course which, unlike a canal, provides drainage for the region.
